item.description:
Conquer the Star Wars galaxy in this intergalactic, hyperdrive version of the fast-trading property game, Monopoly! You can play on the Rebel or the Empire side, and your mission is to conquer planets and build bases so you can dominate the universe! When players land on your planets, they owe you rent - but the same is true when you land on theirs! Powerful Force cards will alter your destiny, but there can be only one winner. When every planet is owned, the game is over - and if the Force is with you, you'll be the ultimate winner!

Includes gameboard, 4 character tokens (2 Rebel, 2 Empire), 44 bases (22 Rebel, 22 Empire, all double-sided), 18 Rebel Force cards, 18 Empire Force cards, 4 symbol cards, 2 dice, 1 money pack and game guide.

Note: This is a different game than Monopoly: Star Wars

item.description:
Rauf und Runter is a roll-and-move board game with a meerkat theme on two layers with a few twists.

The player's meerkat pawns are magnetic and move therefore simultaneously on the top and bottom side of the gaming board.
Players start in the corners and must move their meerkat to a specific location, randomly revealed, and back to a corner. Roll the die and move accordingly one to three spaces to your destination. Borders (hedges, walls) may not be crossed. Then it's the move of the next player.

Once reaching a corner, however, the board is immediately turned upside down and play commences on this side. Players that did not reached their target space get a random one-shot-bonus of either moving two extra spaces, crossing a border, or taking a second move. The first player to visit all locations, then reach a corner wins.

Be sure not to lift your meerkat from the board while moving as this will cause the corresponding figure to fall off.

ÐÐ¿Ð¿ÐµÑ‚Ð¸Ñ‚Ð½Ñ‹Ð¹ Ð·Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ðº (Appetizing Castle) is a push-your-luck dice game, for 2-4 players who try to build the strongest castle for princess Larissa, using dice towers.

The hungry monster Kirpicheyadny ate Princess Larissa's Castle. Players help her to build a new home using dice towers, with as many as 5 dice of different sizes. Dice should be collected from largest to smallest. If building the tower failed, Kirpicheyadny begins to move, and he will want to eat the unfinished castle!

How to draw a monster from the construction? Bake cakes: even a monster makes the right choice, what to eat, when offered a cake and a brick.

From the box:

The fun game of forward thinking and awareness!

Three characteristics... colour, symbol, size.

Place your tiles such that they match other tile(s) already on the table in at least one characteristic. Simple?! Sure it is.

But be extremely cautious with what tile(s) you place. You may just be setting it all up beautifully for your opponent(s) to come in and out-think and out-score you.

Think a few steps ahead... and be aware - be very aware.

A fast paced game for 2-4 players.

Captain Black is a cooperative board game with an electronic game master and a 3D pirate ship. The goal is to protect the pirate ship of Captain Black's ghost against all dangers and reach his treasure island in a given but unknown number of rounds.

After assembling the pirate ship from the box and provided parts, you select the difficulty and activate the figurine of Captain Black's ghost, the electronic game master.

A player round consists of rolling the die, moving up to the rolled number of spaces on the ship with his sailor, moving and activating the Captain, and solving the present or announced tasks at the location: fighting pirates, sea creatures, rats, fires, leaks or some mini games: blind snatching of items, throwing cubes, push ups/knee bends, etc. If all of these tasks are solved before night falls (i.e., the number of rounds is reached), the sailors have won; if night falls or the ship sinks or is seized by the pirates, the game is lost.

The Captain is powered by batteries and directed by plastic platforms on each ship location. The output is acoustic.

item.description:
Disney Riesen Bilder-Rallye is a cooperative spin-and-move children's game with a Disney theme.

The goal is to reach Cinderella's castle before the clock strikes midnight, and the game board is a "wimmelbild", i.e., a look-and-find picture along the lines of Where's Waldo. On your turn, you spin the spinner and act accordingly:


 Numbers 1-8: Move your Disney pawn 1 to 8 spaces on the road forward. 
 Clock: Move the hand of the clock 1 or 2 hours forward.
 Mickey-Mouse: Draw and reveal the first card from the deck, turn over the sand timer, and together try to find and mark with plastic rings the depicted objects on the game board. Stop and count after the timer has run through. All may move their pawns the number of correctly marked objects.


If all reach the castle before the clock strikes midnight, the game is won.

item.description:
Star Wars: Galaxy Rebellion is a press-your-luck dice-rolling game with a Star Wars theme.

As Han, Luke, Leia or Chewbacca, you must help the rebellion to victory. Battle across various planets up to the second Death Star.

On your turn, you roll the custom dice, try to cover at least two symbols on the current planet, and try to earn victory points and/or allies by covering full rows. Your character and many allies will help you. However if you fail to cover one or two symbols, the Sith will cost you dice. Upon completing the planet, move to the next planet until you destroy the Death Star.

Whoever now has the most victory points is declared winner.

Mecha 1945 is a tactical board game where you pilot big robots in a world war II alternate history.

It is a turn-based game, programming and simultaneous resolution. Each turn you can program movement, technic and combat order and resolved them on 91 hexagons board representing Manhattan.

The game is customizable with a lot of game modes, 9 board parts, around 190 cards to build your own mecha and a website with a 3D design module. The idea is that you can assemble the arms, legs, torsos, etc. so as to design the robot that suits you the most. You will have a 3D model that you can output with a 3D printer.

Depending the game mode you have choose you have to destroy foe Mecha, stay in the center of the map, capture flag, escort VIP,...

Play with you friends in teams or against them!

Argentina and Chile almost came to blows over Patagonia at the turn of the century before war was averted. What if peace negotiations had not been achieved? Who would have won the naval contest? Now, using Avalon Hill's Victory in the Pacific (VITP), you can find out for yourself.

Avalon Hill games, though dated, are still among the most fun to play. Unfortunately, they can take a long, long time to play. Even game of VITP can take a good 4-6 hours to play to completion. Patagonia War allows players to play a game with a similar system, but in a much shorter time (5 turns, 3 sea areas, 26 ships).

VAIPA Quarterly #10, Patagonia War, contains the following items:

1. The Rulebook 
2. The Map 
3. Twelve Chile ship counters. Fourteen Argentina ship counters. Six Control markers (counters). 
4. Small zip lock bags to place your counters into (Your option).

In addition, since this game is based on Avalon Hill’s Victory in the Pacific game, you will need a copy of that game. Specifically, you will need:

a. Damage markers 
 b. Disabled markers 
 c. Sunk markers 
 d. Dice 
 e. Rulebook

Égaru Idea to Market is a card game where you can learn the concepts of intellectual property and entrepreneurship.

The goal is to create projects starting with an Idea and ending in the Market, going through the different phases of the entrepreneurship process. To do this you must lay down cards in the correct order and possibly add booster cards to your own projects or attack cards to your opponents. A project requires between 3 and 6 phases to get to market - the more phases you get in the more points you will get.

Each player can have as many projects as he wants, but if a project is not closed with the Market card, it doesn’t count in the final score.

The player with the most points when there are no more cards to play is the winner.

item.description:
Perplexity is a word game in which you attempt to collect letters to spell a 5-letter word. Letters are collected by landing on spaces containing a letter and answering a question. Questions are made up of some form of wordplay (double meanings, anagrams, sounds, etc).

Letters may be stolen or swapped with other players when landing on special locations on the board. All successful actions require answering a question.

The first player to collect 5 letters, spell a word with those letters, make it back to the center of the board and answer a question correctly wins the game.

name.value: Monster High: Share or Scare Game

item.description:
From the box cover:

Grab your ghoul-friends for a fang-tastic game of truth or dare! On your turn, spin the spinner to see your fate...Spin Share and you'll reveal your spookiest secrets, monstrous crushes, and all the stuff that makes you eerily unique...try to guess each others' answers to score! Spin Scare and beware! You'll do one of a hundred challenges so fierce and funny they'll have you in stitches! It's a spook-a-rific race to get 13 points to win the game! Monster High Share or Scare-so fun, it's scary!

item.description:
From the publisher:

Featuring beautifully detailed painted miniatures, X-Wing is a two-player game of dramatic starfighter battles set in the Star Wars universe. You and your opponent take command of Resistance X-wings and First Order TIE fighters, then battle head-to-head for the fate of the galaxy.

Secretly plot your maneuvers, fly at your enemies, take aim, and fire. It takes just minutes to learn the rules, but the nearly limitless possibilities for squad building, along with the ability to expand your fleet with other ships from the game’s expansions, ensure that you’ll find plenty of Star Wars action to explore and enjoy for years to come!

X-Wing is a two-player miniatures game of fantastic, high-speed dogfights. Now, for the first time, you can enjoy these dramatic space battles with the incredible new starfighters from The Force Awakens!

The Force Awakens Core Set is the heart of your X-Wing experience and contains everything that you and a friend need to start playing, including three painted plastic ships – one Resistance T-70 X-wing and two TIE/fo fighters.

item.description: TXT Off (Text-Off) is a standard trivia game where players move around a board answering questions about texting language, shorthand and trivia. Categories may have all players answering or just the player whose turn it is. Players earn points by correctly answering questions. First player to 20 points wins.

ãƒ–ã‚¾ã‚¯ "Tribe" is a rather abstract cardgame rendering the conflict between two Mesoamerican tribes. The game plays over four alternatingly good and bad seasons: trying to increase the size of the tribe in each good season, and attempting to avoid the perils of the bad seasons.

It's explicitly a team game. Teams alternate play: but unlike most such card games, each team-mate plays a card secretly together, then discusses (without revealing anything about the played cards) which should take effect first. Each card played adjusts the ownership of important resources, might grant a hunting token, or might increase (in a good season) or decrease (in a bad) the size of the tribe. Largest tribe at the end of the game wins.

name.value: PWNs: A Game of Strategic Mayhem

item.description:
PWNs is a unique game where you command your team of pawns to traverse a board filled with potentially-dangerous terrain to battle your way to victory.

Your team will use a combination of cards, abilities, and terrain to knock out enemy PWNs.

The object is to knock out just one team from the game. Then whichever team has the most remaining players with the most health points wins!

With so many possible combinations and variations randomly assigned at the beginning of the game, you'll never play the same game twice.

You are a Captain of the UEF! Your RPTR class starship was on routine patrol of the Auborne system when a distress call was received. Upon warping in you quickly realized it was a trap! With the help of your crew, you must survive until a rescue fleet appears.

Deep Space D-6 is a solitaire dice game about surviving the cruel depths of space. Each turn you’ll roll Crew dice and assign them to stations. You must plan carefully to take care of internal and external threats to your ship. Survive to win.

name.value: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege

item.description:
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege is a game that utilizes WizKids Games' proprietary Dice Building Game platform in which two players take the role of warlords, collect and assemble their "party" of adventurer dice and battle in head-to-head gameplay. Each turn, players roll the dice to see what resources they have available, buy dice, send their party members into the field, and then strike at the enemy warlord. There are multiple cards available for each type of die so players get to choose which one to use. This lets players specialize dice to suit play style.

Additional cards and dice to expand your collection can be found in expansion packs. Each Foil Pack contains two cards and two dice that players can add to their Dice Masters Faerûn Under Siege collections. Players can create teams of their favorite fantasy characters from the Forgotten Realms universe.

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters line will consist of starter sets, a Collector's Box, booster packs, play mats, and a "Party" storage box.

item.description:
Invasion: Malta uses many familiar game mechanics found in similar scale games. Featured here are chit draws for activation of formations and individual unit efficiency ratings. The Axis player uses amphibious landings and airdrops to bring his units into the battle while the Allied player defends with artillery bombardment from behind heavy fortifications. Special rules include heavy tanks and dummy airdrops, and more, as found in a group of random events that players draw in order to obtain special capabilities, such as Deception Measures, Gas, Anti-tank guns, Transport, Smoke Screen, and much more. As you might expect, the game includes the highest quality OoB for both sides for each scenarios; we really dug into various national archives for this game. All scenarios stop after only a few days of campaigning as it is during this time that the battle would be decided.

Our hobby has perhaps a unique ability to explore the great questions of events in history. Here, what if during WWII the Axis actually invaded Malta. Who would win? The answer turns on many additional questions and circumstances. This two-player game explores several of these in three scenarios plus the bonus game covering the historical invasion of Leros.

Fall 1940: The Italians had big talk and many objectives during the war but not enough realistic plans. Perhaps the best time for their invasion would be in the fall, and perhaps timed along with the German invasion of Britain; or, if the Germans do not invade, then perhaps in place of the actual Italian invasion of Greece. Operational plans for Malta were poor but British defenses are weak. Perhaps the Italians could catch the British not reacting in time.

Spring 1941: In April 1941 the Axis had a choice, either occupy Crete or attack Malta. On April 21st Gen. Student, chief of the paratroopers, overcame opposition from the Wehrmacht Operations Staff, and others, in Berlin and persuaded Hitler to attack Crete. But, what if Hitler accepted the alternative recommendation to attack Malta? The Germans and Italians would now have to prepare for a combined operation, air, land, and sea, and do this quickly. The forces arrayed against Malta would have been huge, but the British were far better prepared than a year before and well fortified. The bloody issue would have been in doubt from the start.

Summer 1942: After a over year of preparation and study and agreement on the need to invade, the combined German and Italian staffs had put together an extensive and complex plan for invasion. Its success depended on many factors and lessons had been learned from the battle for Crete the year before had been put into effect. All was as ready as it could be, yet they did not invade. The British were stronger in numbers and weapons but their efficiency was down due to the long siege. Was it just Hitler’s nervousness about such an unusual Axis operation, or was it the allure of bigger victories elsewhere?

November 1943, Leros: The possibility of invading Malta had passed but the British had put themselves out on a small island in the Aegean, Leros. Incredibly, a large part of the British garrison consisted of the former Malta garrison, now well rested. In effect, it was a miniature Malta. This time the Germans did not hesitate, they invaded by sea and air. This tough little infantry fight shows just what grit was involved and how the experience of fighting on Malta would have been. The British lost, but the battle was close. All the flavor of the Malta battle is here but at only one-third of the size.

TIME SCALE: 8 hours per turn
MAP SCALE: 600 yards per hex
UNIT SCALE: Battalions and companies

WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is the second volume of GMT's exciting Wing Leader game series, which started with Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942. WING LEADER allows you to play out large-scale aerial combats in World War II.

Based on a unique side-scrolling view, WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 lets you recreate the climactic air battles at the end of the war. Scenarios feature fights above the Reich, Normandy, Italy, Romania, the Eastern Front, and the Pacific. Players fly squadrons and flights, attempting to intercept raids or fend off marauding fighters in fast-playing games that take between 90 and 120 minutes. Rules cover late war armaments such as air-to-air rockets and jet aircraft.

WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is a stand-alone game and features more aircraft, more squadrons, and more battles. When combined with its sister game, WING LEADER: Victories 1940-1942, this second volume creates an experience that spans the entire war.

Components:

Rule Book
Scenario Book
22 x 34" Mounted Map
700 Counters in four countersheets
48 2.5 x 3.5" Aircraft Data Cards
Two Wing Displays
Three Player Aid Cards
Two six-sided Dice

From the publisher:

SlapCAT is a wildly fast reflex game full of slapped cats, cats in hats, dead rats, and poo. Players race to slap the parts they need, then try to build a beautiful cat while throwing fishbones and stealing from their neighbors.

Each round players build a hand of cards by slapping from a limited selection of cat parts. The players then play from this hand of cards to build a high scoring cat in front of them. But watch out -- your neighbors may attack and take your only head! What's a cat with no head?!

A mixture of reflexes, card drafting and strategic card play, SlapCAT is feisty fun that's over so fast your friends and family will be clawing at you to play again!

Travel through the galaxy as you buy, sell and trade organizations, factions and locations as depicted in the Mass Effect video game trilogy.

Includes:

 6 Collectible Tokens: N7 Helmet, Space Hamster, Normandy, Omni Tool, Shifty Looking Cow, and Mako
 Custom Game Board featuring Elites, Special Interests, Mercs, and Crews
 Custom Chance & Community Chest Cards

This is an educational game to think and easy mechanics, wich are based on questions and answers. We must get to the place where the challenge lies for each player who randomly received a letter of challenge.This show you the objects you will need have before departure to your challenge. But to move your figure you need energy and this energy it´s won with the correct answers to the questions of the letters

Spanish description:
Un juego al estilo del trivial (Porque es de ir respondiendo preguntas), pero más atractivo al tener que buscar cierto equipo y luego llegar a un punto del mundo según la "misión" que te tocase

The Chu–Han Contention is updated and commercial edition of Chuhan War, a historical wargame of Chu–Han Contention from 206 B.C. to 202 B.C.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuâ€“Han_Contention
The game includes three short scenarios and one long scenario. Each player plays the role of Xiang Yu, Liu Bang or Han Xin (only in 3-player scenario).

This small Star Wars edition of the classic Bop It! game features the franchise's beloved droid, R2-D2.

The game commands you to take certain actions (Bop it, Twist it, Pull it) in the voice of C-3PO, and you have to respond as fast as you can. If you get it right, you get another chance, but if you don't, you're out! The commands get faster the longer you go on, and you'll hear the sounds of the loyal droid R2-D2 as you play. 
(description from Hasbro)

No moderator, no elimination, five-minute games.

Blink of Death is a fast game for 4-12 players in which everyone gets a role: One of the Shifter Demons, the Abandoned, the helpful Anchorite, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In 30 seconds, The Demon must kill one others or lose.

Because Blink of Death is so fast, fun, and engaging, you'll want to play it again and again, and no two games are ever the same.

item.description:
A great family game based on classic and recent movies.
Spend hours of fun as you try to recall details from your favourite movies. Your brain cells will be "Smokin'" as you try to beat the clock and your opponents, to be first with the correct answer.
The design of the gameboard allows you to answer questions both on your own turn or the turn of another player!
If you disagree with another player's answer you can dispute and provide another response.

A team of infiltrators from the triad penetrated the police force. However, the police also has sent a team of undercover agents to infiltrate the triad. Ten years later, they are still undercover, but their minds have been twisted by the temptation of power, authority and money — and nobody is certain about their original roles anymore. Both groups learn that they have been infiltrated and want to ferret out the moles. Each mole has a secret code to lock their identity file, and once the code is cracked their identity is fully revealed. The battle of wits starts now. Either exposing the enemy or taking the chance to change the identity for good can save their lives as long as nobody knows who is who!

Internal Affairs is an intense elimination game between infiltrators from both the Triad and the Police Force Infiltrator. Each player has a set of secret ID cards which determine that player's allegiance. Each player also has a secret code, which when cracked reveals the player's real ID. At the beginning of the game, each player has five code cards and chooses three of them to be the secret code that locks the identity file. During their turn, players try to crack other players' codes to find out who is who and get their team to victory. Due to action cards, though, ID cards may be passed from player to player and this may change each player's allegiance. Players must be quick to win, as otherwise they may end up in the losing team when they least expect it.

Internal Affairs is designed for 5-8 players, but alternative rules have been included to allow for play with 2-4.

item.description: Ormen Långe is a children's game where the players roll a die with different colors on the sides, telling which square to go to. If the square has a snake piece on it, the player can collect this and add to his snake to make it longer. The player with the longest snake at the end of the game is the winner.

Het Supersnelle Kennisspel.

A quiz game for kids from the primary school. They test their knowledge about school-topics and earn victory points by answering multiple choice questions correctly. There are ways to steal points from other players too.

The objective is to gain the most number of victory points after a predetermined number of questions.

Draw and read a scenario card out loud. Players each select the cards from their hands that they think will win them the round. The person that read the scenario picks her favorite card for the scenario. The person that was picked gets a point and reads the next scenario card.

The player with the most points (White Cards) at the end of the game is the winner.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

item.description: Revansch is a real-estate game, where player starts with low capital and collects sets of properties and invests to industry. The player moves around the board trying to visit places like bank, stockmarket and salary. The winner is the only player left after the other players left the game due to bankruptcy.

Treasure Island is a roll-and-move game where players hunt for pirate treasure. It is included in The Great Pirate Activity Book, published by Kingfisher. There are four starting points, each marked by a ship and leading to a different track. Each player chooses a ship and places his or her starting marker on it. More than one player may choose the same ship. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their marker along the track, following the directions on spaces where they land. Spaces may move players forward or back on the track or cause gain of loss of turns. When a player reaches the pirate treasure on an exact roll, he or she then heads back the starting ship. The first player back to his or her starting ship wins.

Often confused with Dennis the Menace and Gnasher, this is actually a very different game of set collection and movement.
Players are required to move around the board to different locations, collecting Menace and mischief cards while avoid Dad and the Slipper! The location cards all require a different number and combination of Menace cards to be completed and the first to complete a set number is the winner!

There’s a Snitch in the Mafia, and the Godfather has ordered us to take him out! Snitch is a hidden identity card game set in the world of the mafia, played with 4-6 friends in about 15 to 30 minutes. Play as the Mobster and attempt to whack the Snitch. Or play as the Snitch, and frame the mobsters so they turn on each other! Watch out for the Police, as they can be tipped off towards anyone. If we don't whack the Snitch in time, he's sure to get into protective custody!

A round consists of a hit being placed on one of the players. Whether or not they’re a Snitch is for you to decide. Use cards in your hand to attack, or protect the target. Cash can be used to influence the hit in either direction! If enough damage is dealt to a player, they can be sent to the hospital, or whacked!

Players take part in Mob Jobs. If the job is snitched on, the game gets more difficult for the Mobsters, and the Snitch gets closer to protective custody. The deck also consists of mafia associates, who's skills can be used to further your agenda.

The Mobsters win if they whack the Snitch! The Snitch wins if enough Mobsters are whacked, or if enough police are in play!

Description from the publisher:

The players travel around Jeju Island, the most beautiful island in Korea, and gather treasure tiles along the way. By gathering treasure tiles in Play Jeju, players can collect point cards with special effects. The player with the most points wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

item.description:
Translated from the back of the Finnish edition box:

TOM tom tom TOM tom tom ... tactful Native American drumming raises the atmosphere, the cards turn, drumming stops and the race to find the right image begins! The one who is the fastest, slaps their hand on the right card and wins the plume into his Indian headband.

The first to get five plumes into his headband will be the Great Chief, and he wins the game!

A challenging fifty four card cooperative real time trading game (With optional singing).

You play as a group of friends inhabiting a shared nightmare. Your hand consists of nightmarish aspects and you goal is to trade these with your friends. If someone can get a collection of similar aspects then they can master that part of the nightmare and contribute to your eventual escape - however each card that you receive in trade can force you to undertake certain actions, restrict who you trade with or limit how you can communicate. To make matters worse something is chasing you through the nightmare and you have to trade its card every ten seconds or be devoured. It's coming. Run.

During set-up players choose a collection of nightmare types based on the number of players. This choice allows a group to include or exclude certain mechanics - so whether your nightmare will be an all singing all dancing nightmare is down to the exuberance of the players rather than luck of the draw.

Escape the Nightmare is a challenging experience, with the average group losing a fair few games before their first victory. However the play time is quick and resetting for another go takes seconds. There are six difficulty levels to make the game accessible for groups of any level of skill and selecting different types of nightmare allows players to set the tone of their game to suit their preferences.

item.description: Jeu du Cirque is a board game that is played in 15 minutes. It consists of a board, 4 pawns and 2 dice, each for a different level reached on he board, with colours and pictures on the die sides. Players roll the dice and advance their tokens along the board, like in Snakes and Ladders. Depending on the square that they end up on, they can either ride along the neck of the giraffe and win tickets, or descend on the trapeze and fall back several spaces. The winner is the player who arrives first at the circus tent, at the top of the board.

From the publisher:

The squish or be squished family game. Will you be the last player with the unsquished fish? Start the game with your own school of dough-fish. Flip cards in turn until you complete a three-in-a-row. When you do, you are awarded a "free squish" of any opponent's fish. Stay on your fins! Everyone is trying to squish your fish too! Last "fish" standing wins!

La Quête des Chevaliers (Knights' Quest) is a boardgame that is primarily a memory mechanic game.

The two players face each other, both players must remember the location of the Excalibur swords and dragons laid about the board. Then they close their eyes, moving their finger on the plateau to reach the castle of their opponent without touching a dragon. And when they find Excalibur, they win gold coins. Players must therefore memorize the course and stay well focused. The winner is the player who wins the most coins by reaching the other's castle.

link.value: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

item.description: Devine Super Héros is a game of memory and deduction. Each game lasts 15 minutes. Among a hand of 16 cards, each player chooses a character and places it on a stand before them, hidden from their opponent. By asking each other questions, each player must guess the Super Hero chosen by the other player. The first to guess the other's superhero wins! This plays very similarly to Guess Who.

An excellent addition to the My First Play World series from HABA, the ' Animal Merry-Go-Round Motor Skill Game will be both fun and educational for your little one! Each animal has his home. The cheeky friends, however, have a lot of fun with the turning disk and love to change places! Who can return order to the jumble? To do so, little zoo friends need a good touch and some luck at turning the seesaw. Specially designed to foster motor skills and introduce the concept of games with instructions. This set includes fun game ideas to keep little ones entertained for longer. Made in Germany, the board and tiles are sturdy cardboard and the pieces are made of beech wood. The game includes 1 elephant (3.00" tall), 1 lion, 1 zebra, 1 flamingo, 1 monkey, 1 rotatable seesaw, 10 play tiles, 1 game board, set of instructions. Perfect for children ages 2 years and up.

Cha-rades? Hey, what's that? Charades is a way of describing things without using words and by using only gestures, facial expressions and body movements. The aim of the game is to guess as many of the things acted out during the game as fast as possible. Classic fun for all ages! Includes blank cards so you can act out whatever you like. Portable Version in a tin by HABA!

Four adventurers. Four attacks... but only one will slay the monster.

In Squish’em!: Fantasy – you will play the Elf, the Summoner, the Barbarian and the Speller against more than 20 different monsters : a Cute Lil Bunny, a Cockatrice, a Manotaur, a Hat Golem, a Boy scout…

These “monsters” (often cute or funny) are too terrorized to counter-attack, but be careful because the other players want the same thing you want : give the coup de grâce to that adorable little creature.

Your goal is simple : be the first to slay 3 creatures.

Unfortunately, you can collide with other players or find your attacks cancelled by a monster or player's effect.

Squish’em!: Fantasy is the first game of the series Squish’em! All these games are stand-alone and can also be mixed to play with more heroes and more monsters.

Components : Box - Rules - 66 cards

A Bible trivia game translated from the Dutch game Kwistet. 396 questions about people, places, and events of the Bible. 
Answering questions correctly allows players to move their pieces around a Pachisi-like board; the winner is the one to get both playing pieces 'home' first.

Two decks of cards provide different difficulty levels; a third deck (for children) is available separately.

Broke Hill, 1981. The city is experiencing a surge in violence, and the popular local group of superheroes, "The Guardians" can not cope. They are looking for a new recruit.

Each of the players will be in the shoes of one of the rookie heroes who intend to join "The Guardians". To do this they will have their abilities (each will be specialized in one of the four - Strength, Speed, Elements and psychic) and Heroic Resources (cards).

The test is to undergo a normal day in the city, solving real missions. Which achieved more (and more important) missions, who will stay with the job.

Each turn the First Player will show several missions. Each player will place a bid for the mission he wants. Every player will face one mission per turn, and try to fulfill it.
To get it you will use as many dice as your main characteristic for this mission, and you can negotiate and use bonus cards to do it easier.

The hero with the most Mission Points will win, and will join "The Guardians".

item.description:
Card filler on the mechanics of "rock-paper-scissors."

"The old dungeon of the castle of King Cybertania full of weapons, stones, and ancient scrolls. However, the magician Algorimus created evil robots-Golems, who attack anyone who dared to walk through the dungeon. You - a brave knight, whom the king had locked in the dungeon, along with your rivals. Your task - to survive in the dungeon, to preserve and increase your team Knights and collect the most Trophies and destroy more SteamBots"

Players in the game turn-by-turn move tokens of his knights on the game field, consisting of Terrain cards and take the card out of the deck, indicating findings on that place.

It may be Trophies, robots-SteamBots or pieces of another Territory. If two or three players meet on one Terrain card, they fight among themselves for the findings by the "rock-paper-scissors" card.

The winner is the player that kept more Knights in the team, destroy more STEAMBOTs and earned the most Trophies. For all of this, The King get Gold. More Gold - and you are best (and famous) Knight.

link.value: Battle of Golems: The Algorithmic Card Game

name.value: Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!"

item.description:
Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!" lets you become the Producer, Director, Writer and Agent of a Big Box Office Hollywood movie!

When you arrive in Hollywood, you first go to work. After you make $10,000 you enter the main playing board. As you move your token around the board, you accumulate "Industry Title Rings," such as Black for Producer, Red for Director, Blue for Writer and Green for Agent.

As you go around the board, you accumulate "Movie Titles" when you enter the theatre where the movie is playing. You enter the theatre and multiply your profits depending on how many "Industry Title Rings" you have on your token.

Other squares have "Pick Director (or other industry title) Card." These cards direct you to other areas of the board, which can be good or bad, depending on which "Movie Titles" you have.

You can also land on a "Spin the Wheel" square. This wheel will either give or take away your industry title.

The first person to make $1,000,000 wins the game.

Space Yoghurt is a competitive game for two to four space adventurers. By rolling dice and making use of the moon's strategic places, the player maneuvers his or her crew into the spaceship's cockpit and strives to win the cosmic vacation. Will you be the one who receives the Golden Ticket from the Galactic Empress Yolibolibana III?

Each player has a crew of three spaceters and takes turn to roll the three crew dice to move along the moon track. If you end up on a Bouncy Crater you can make haste and bounce all the way to the cockpit, soaring past the other spaceters. Ending up on a Yoghurt Pool gives you special powers, but the Space Yoghurt is wacky strong and must be handled with care. It might win you the game, sending other players' spaceters home or be so bitter that you must go home and rest for a while. Easy rules, fast play and big wins! See you out there, brave space adventurers!

item.description:
Mr. President is a solitaire game about governing as the President of the United States. It's not an election game. It begins after you've been elected. It's about sitting in The Chair and trying to advance your agenda while navigating ongoing crises, political enemies, public opinion, your relations with Congress and the press, and keeping your country secure in a world of rival nations and agendas that just seems to keep blowing up around you. Mr. President is a resource management game, where you never have enough resources to achieve your entire agenda, and the path you take through an always unpredictable storyline rests on the choices you make. Depending on the results of those choices, and on the unfolding of a "different every game" story, you'll either be thinking "POTUS? Piece of Cake!" or "Why was it that I WANTED this job?" many times in each game.

Like the actual President, you'll have an array of allies and resources to help you as you navigate both the corridors of power in the nation's capital and the uncertainties of international relations. These allies and resources will vary from game to game, but you'll always be able to rely on your Secretary of State and Secretary of Defense to help you with foreign policy and with the use, where you deem necessary, of the combat power of the U.S. military. You'll also have a bevy of domestic advisors and friends in Congress to help you navigate the many challenges in Congress and domestic life and politics. And you'll always have access to at least one truly exceptional talent (this, too, will vary from game to game), someone who excels in their particular job and is a "force multiplier" for you in their own unique way. How you lead and utilize this mix of talents and experience at your disposal will go a long way toward determining your success or failure during your shot at being Mr. President.

Game Play

The Map. The game map allows you to see and track the domestic and world situation that the game creates. It is divided into sections:

1. Congress. This is where you track progress of legislation, as well as keep track of your friends and opponents in Congress.

2. Advisors and Assets. This section of the map is a holding area for all of your advisors, available action points, and military assets.

3. Crisis Management. This is where you manage the Crisis Cards and keep track of crisis status and how well you've dealt with each crisis.

4. The World portion of the map (about half of the map) is divided into eight world regions, with additional sections for Russia and China (your key potential antagonists in the game). Here's a look at the South America Region, as an example of the regional displays:

Crisis Cards. At the heart of Mr. President are the 150+ Crisis Cards that help create the storyline for each game. These cards - see the 12 sample cards on this page - are a mix of cards representing Domestic or World Crises, Terrorism Events, Unexpected Benefits, and Opportunities. The Crisis Cards help drive, but do not completely control, the storyline in each game. Here's how it works:

Each game of Mr. President is divided into eight turns, each representing six months in office. These turns are further divided into six Rounds, each representing one month.

At the start of each turn, you get to perform assessment and planning actions, where you get to lay out your rough plan, re-examine strategy, re-evaluate the threats and opportunities that were presenting as the previous turn ended (or at game start). So there is definitely a proactive strategy piece to the game. Unfortunately, though, your plans are not often going to survive intact once the turn gets going. The world stage is a dynamic platform.

Once you have your plans made (and the Mr. President gods laugh at you!), you perform the six monthly rounds in order. During each round, you draw three Crisis Cards that represent that main world or domestic events that happen (these are usually bad from your point of view, but occasionally they are events or resources that help you) during that month. Most of the events on the Crisis Cards present you with both an urgent problem that may immediately alter the board state, and a longer term issue that may linger and cause you pain down the road if you don't address it well.

After you flip and resolve the three Crisis Cards for the round, you get to take actions, using any of your available personnel and resources. These actions allow you to make progress on your legislative agenda, attempt to address any new crises presented by the round's three actions cards, deal with any lingering world or domestic issues, fight terrorism, perform diplomacy, and attempt to better your situation in the world or in the eyes of the American people.

Once you finish your action portion of the round, that round (month) is finished, and you move on to the next round, drawing three new Crisis Cards and repeating the round process until the 6-month turn is complete.

Seeded within the 18-card mix that makes up a turn, you have six cards for Russian and Chinese Actions, Terror Actions, War Progress, Crisis Checks, and White House Life. You know that each of these six cards will show up sometime during each turn, but you don't know when. The variable timing of these cards' appearance each turn adds uncertainty and spice to the game, while ensuring that major players in the game present challenges for you every single turn. Russia and China offer deeper challenges, with four possible postures (aggression levels) for each country and a country-specific AI for each. Postures may shift in-game in response to your actions or to storyline events, making dealing positively with each nation an evolving challenge all game.

Please note that Mr. President is NOT a "beer and pretzels" surface-level game. This game is intended to be deep and immersive, one that will both frustrate and delight the solitaire player. Playing time is four to eight hours (depending on your experience level) to play an entire 4-year term. I've tried to pack as much fun as possible into each 6-month turn, so that even if you only have time to play one turn on a weeknight, you'll be engaged, frustrated, challenged, and immersed throughout. That said, I hope you're going to find it difficult to stop playing after each turn. I've designed Mr. President to be an experience that will wrap you up in each new game's story, and beckon you back to the game table after each round, turn, or completed game.

I designed this game to provide massive replayability. With over 150 Crisis cards in the mix, and multiple subsystems representing the US Economy, Congress, Homeland Security, the Press, Presidential Prestige, Russia, China, Hostile Rogue States, and staunch Allies, no two games of Mr. President will ever play remotely alike. If you think you're ready for that challenge, go ahead. Raise your right hand and swear the oath. Then settle in behind the desk in the Oval Office, and let your imagination run wild!

I hope playing Mr. President brings you as much enjoyment as designing it has brought me!

- Gene

Components

22 x 34” mounted game board
165 Cards
600 counters and markers 
rulebook 
playbook
six card stock player aid cards
one ten-sided and two six-sided dice

item.description:
In the year 2661, humanity makes contact with a dying alien race, the Mirrugennin, whose survival depends upon a constant influx of a rare substance known as primordium, found only in a remote section of an asteroid field close to the Mirrugennin's home world.

Unfortunately, the feeble Mirrugennin are incapable of acquiring the primordium for themselves, because they would never survive the inevitable encounters with the monstrous Raptezoids and their horrific mother, the Hive Queen, with which the primordium rich asteroids are infested. And so various human factions agree, for a handsome fee, to mine the Primordium for the Mirrugennin, and to battle, and when possible, gather specimens of the Raptezoids for the Mirrugennin to study.

It is not long before the lust for wealth sends these mining factions into conflict with one another, as they each seek to claim more and more asteroids for themselves. Ordinary space miners, most often equipped with nothing more than their trusty pick-axes, have to quickly figure out how to become soldiers as they are sent headlong into bloody battle against the armies of other mining factions. These conflicts become known as the Primoridum Wars, and rage for several years before the Mirrugennin suddenly and mysteriously disappear.

You will play the leader of one these human factions. You will expand your primordium mining operations throughout the asteroid field, fight the terrible Raptezoids, and wage war against your opponents. At the end of five rounds, the player with the most wealth wins the game.

The Primordium Wars is a quasi tile placement and resource gathering game where players place tiles representing various buildings onto their asteroids in order to increase their primordium mining operations. It is also a game in which combat plays a significant, though secondary role, where players attack each other in order to claim more resource producing asteroids, or to disrupt their opponents operations. The game takes place on a modular board where, in each round, players slowly shift the asteroids around on the game board. Because of this, very interesting things can take place, such as: A path is suddenly created leading straight to an opponent's once well protected mining hub, or two players suddenly find that their starships are now in the same sector where a massive space battle is imminent, or an opponent's dangerous class A starship is now cut off.

In each round, players will first acquire, in a bidding phase, tiles that represent the items needed to expand their mining empires such as various asteroid modules to be built on the asteroids (mining facilities, orbital turrets, pulse cannons, science laboratories, etc), various starship upgrades (warp drives, sniping lasers, stealth devices, etc), miner and mercenary reinforcements, build points for building new starships, and grav technology for tethering asteroids together into clusters (a core mechanism that greatly increases mining production, and expands the functionality of most modules built on the asteroids).

Players will then deploy their newly acquired items onto their asteroids and starships, take turns moving their pieces deeper into the asteroid field in order to expand their mining empire, fight Raptezoids and the dreaded Hive Queen, and battle other players through a diceless blind/bluff mechanism in which players that are in conflict secretly and simultaneously make, and then reveal, their battle plans. (This allows for thrilling Operation Bodyguard/Overlord type strategies where you make an opponent think you are attacking HERE, drawing out his forces, but then you really attack HERE, where he is vulnerable.)

Other core mechanisms: The configurations of players' starships are customizable, and kept hidden from opponents, and the more mining facilities built on any particular asteroid, the greater the chance Raptezoids will appear on that asteroid, and hence the greater the chance that they will summon their queen. This is accomplished by die rolls during the "Raptezoid Phase".

At the end of each round players will collect their income from their mining operations and Raptezoid research, and a new round will begin.

From the publisher:

GrowthBreaker. It’s here. The world’s second tabletop novel.

This is a card game for anyone to play alone. It contains whimsical items, enjoyable places, and helpful friends. Your heroes will be challenged in their quest to reach the goals of each season, which are broken up into several serialized decks known as episodes.

The game is also a story. The major plot of GrowthBreaker is always the same, but what you do during the game, and if your survive, is up to you. It can be played an endless amount of times, without ever experiencing the same game twice.

The object of the game is for the player to move a token around the PLACE PILE, acquiring cards out of the DECK as you travel. The more cards you acquire, the stronger your heroes will grow, allowing more powerful cards to be played.

But be warned, the more powerful your heroes become, the more powerful the enemies that will find them.

A game of GrowthBreaker ends when Starting HERO card(s) of the episode is/are Cycled.

From the box front:

The 3D Balancing Animal Game. Easy to learn, exciting and quick to play and Educational too! To beat the clock, pile on the pressure, don't tip the balance. Hundreds of ways to win.

From the box rear: The first player turns over top card and the sand timer. The player then attempts to Score by performing a successful Balazoo before the timer runs out. A successful Balazoo occurs when all 5 animals are arranged in a pattern very similar to that shown on the configuration card. The player must take their hands away and the animals must freely stand.

After overcoming many dangers, you have finally found the treasure of Captain Flint. You'll have to calculate properly when to claim your share of the treasure since the other pirates also want their part, and you must be ready by the time Parche, Captain Flint's parrot, appears.

And all this before the ghost of the Captain arrives on the scene.

Capitán Flint is a frenzied card game for 2-6 brave and gutsy pirates. Catch the parrot Parche to find the treasure, collect as many gems and coins from it before Flint's ghost catches you, and become the richest pirate.

At the end of the game, the player who has collected more jewels from Flint's treasure wins!

A chess-style game using a hexagonal grid (with seven cells across each edge) and 25 custom pieces per player. Pieces may move in straight lines in up to 12 directions, either through the sides or corners of the cells, capturing pieces by landing on them. A player loses when their "God" is captured.

The game supports either two or three players, with each player starting with control of a "universe" that is the region of cells formed within the triangle of three consecutive corners of the board. In a two-player game, the universes are opposite. In a three-player game, they form a complete ring around the edge of the board.

Players may place their pieces anywhere within their universe at the start of the game (with no fixed set-up), even holding some pieces back to be placed on the board (in their universe) during play. The exceptions are the three corners, which must be empty before play begins (the central corner is termed the "throne" and the two flanking corners are the "palace gates").

The types of playing piece (with number of pieces per player listed in brackets) move as follows:

 God (1): one step in any direction.
 Ruler (2): unlimited steps in any direction.
 Ambassador (4): unlimited steps through sides only.
 Warrior (4): unlimited steps through corners only.
 Priest (2): one step through sides only.
 Spy (2): one step through corners only.
 Minion (10): one step in any direction.




Only a God or Ruler can occupy the throne. A Minion can be substituted with a different captured piece if it reaches an opponent's palace gates (to any piece except a Ruler) or an opponent's throne (where it can be substituted for a captured Ruler).

An educational game that uses Abstracts of Sciences to assist students learning the major oxidative pathways, glycolysis and the citric acid cycle. The multicolored gameboard shows these pathways with each metabolic intermediate identified by name, structural formula and number of carbon atoms. The names of the enzymes are printed on arrows that symbolize the chemical reactions of the pathways.

The players move tokens representing carbon atoms along the pathways. A molecule of a carbon compound is symbolized by a stack of the proper number of tokens. Thus glucose would have six tokens, and 3-phosphoglyceraldehyde, three.
 A deck of 70 “enzyme cards” is used to regulate the play. Each card shows a reaction present on the board with the name of the enzyme. To move a molecule from one step in a pathway to the next, a player must have in hand the appropriate enzyme card. There are three enzyme cards in the deck for each reaction on the board as well as four “wild enzyme” cards which may be used to catalyze any reaction. The game makes use of ATP “currency” of three denominations: one, three and ten ATP units. The ATP is gained or lost by a player depending on the reactions being carried out as the game proceeds. The object of the game is to gain more ATP than the other players. Oxidative phosphorylation is simulated by the use of tokens representing NADH and FADH, and special cards representing oxygen. Oxygen debt is simulated whenever a player with reducing power lacks oxygen cards.

Ladies and gentlemen! The biggest sporting event is about to begin, THE SNAIL RACE. All players get ready in the starting line with a clear goal: AVOID TO BE THE FIRST WHO ARRIVES TO THE FINISH LINE.

Players should use the result of the dice to move the snail figures of the other players so that their snails remains in last position at the end of the race.

item.description:
Designed by Hiroyuki Okinoi, this game is published in a Japanese / English edition.

The Empress of Time inadvertently triggers a malfunction that causes different time intervals and parallel words to intersect. You are an adventurer who is unwittingly sucked into this time spiral. Your objective is collecting a form of energy called mana and bringing the world back to order, allowing you to return to your own time.

The objective of play is to travel the game board and collect mana, a strange form of energy, before the other players. Players advance the number of squares according to the number rolled on the die. Cast Cards can be set along points of the board, allowing a player to collect payment from others. “Cast” refers to the residents of the alien world. Once a player collects 100 mana, he wins by returning to Start. This means that even if another player has more mana than you, if you reach the goal with 100 mana in hand, you are the winner. To decide runners-up, count the number of mana each player has at the end of the game.

item.description:
"Fight monsters to impress the King and become a Knighted Royal Mage of Ebenor!"

Brief feel of gameplay
Players use Mana cards and optional character abilities to fight a shared field of monsters in a way requiring light, but engaging strategy and careful observation of their opponents situation.

Mechanical overview
The structure of the game is for players to balance the value of cards they place down below monsters, in order to draw new cards and gain either their cards or the monsters themselves as 'prestige' (points) over multiple rounds until there are no monsters left or any player has run out of cards.

name.value: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks Anthology

item.description:
From the official website: Never before have so many gathered in one place. These will be fights to remember.

These eight, ready-to-play, 60-card Magic decks showcase the first four dueling match-ups. Rejoin the fray as the game's most famous Planeswalkers go head to head. Relive the Divine clashing with the Demonic, and Elves confronting Goblins. Replay the original duels, or mix and match the combatants to create new battles across the Multiverse.

Duel Decks: Anthology contains all eight decks from the first four Duel Decks products:


 Duel Decks: Elves vs. Goblins
 Duel Decks: Jace vs. Chandra
 Duel Decks: Divine vs. Demonic
 Duel Decks: Garruk vs. Liliana


Note: Does not expand the base game. Not collectible. Completely stand alone 1v1 duel decks.

link.value: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Divine vs. Demonic
Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Elves vs. Goblins
Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Garruk vs. Liliana
Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Jace vs. Chandra

item.description: Bluff-Yatzy is a variation of Yatzy, where the player can hide dice with the help of 3 stackable cups. The player may when be bluffing about the result. The winner is the player with the best dice-combinations and/or best bluffing skills.

Välkommen till samhället is a board game there the players starts as a new born and walks thru lifes different events. The player roll dice and moves around board, coming in contact with agencies, feelings, standards, institutes and different problems. The aim is to try to stay alive as long a possible.

name.value: Wilson's Creek: Opening Round in the West, 10 August 1861

item.description:
From the back page of the game:

Wilson's Creek uses the simplified QuickPlay version of the Musket & Saber system of warfare during the muzzle-loading era. Combat is based on unit quality rather than raw numbers, and rewards use of historical tactics.

Star Patrol: Carrier Commander is a 1-2 player tabletop game in which each person controls a starcraft carrier and its six squadrons of fighters and bombers. Players take turns launching their squadrons, dogfighting in space, firing torpedoes at the enemy carrier, and escaping back to their own mothership. There, they reload, refuel, and line up on the flight deck to launch on another mission. You must destroy all enemy squadrons to win.

The Deluxe Kickstarter Edition adds dropships and space marines to shut down opponent carriers, asteroids both as dynamic terrain and for a standalone navigate-the-asteroid-field solo mission, and a starbase overlay and defense towers to convert the space board into a trench run battle to destroy the space station. It also includes civilian science ships and transports for escort and raiding missions.

item.description:
As the leader of the team, you should make the best use of the heros at your disposal.
The more wars, armors, and territories you claim, the closer you are to victory.

Powerful prophets and sacred animals will help you reverse the situation.
But watch out for other players, maybe they are figuring the same thing.

Hero cards form the player's hand cards.
Players use them to claim Legend cards, attack other players, and defend oneself.

Legend cards include Wars, Armors, Territories, and Sacred Animals.
They provide VP in different ways and are contested by players.

Players score VP by claiming Legend cards, the player with the most VP wins the game.

Summary for Game Flow

Turn flow:
Turn over 2 Legend cards, and the active player performs 3 actions.

Actions:
(A) Claim a card with your Hero.
(B) Claim a card with your Prophet.
(C) Snatch a card from another player.
(D) Recall Heros from your Hero deck.

Game End:
When the rotated card is revealed, the final round begins.
The game is played for 10/7/5 rounds in 2/3/4 -player games.

"What is this all about"

- David Livingstone

Well David,

This is a game of adventure and exploration where you, together with five other players, venture into deepest Africa. The time period is mid-19th century and you start your expedition at one of the six Ports of Entry.

Your journey is financed by a major newspaper and publisher back home, and they expect you to bring home fantastic stories that they can publish. Your expedition consists of you and armed askaris, which are local African soldiers, and porters that carry food and gifts. There will be occasional local guides and goats to keep you company.

The quest is to trek into what is unknown to you. You will interact with people that you meet, while searching for the myths and legends that are said to exist somewhere in Africa. To walk the land among people that might not appreciate your presence, to face hunger and predators, and to reveal what perhaps should remain hidden is dangerous. Not only are the lives of your expedition at stake, but your sanity as well.

But then again, as the old trader said, "are you not entering the Heart of Darkness?"

The map covers Central and Southern Africa and is divided along ethnic groups. Your expedition/marker moves from area to area searching for myths and legends. You only carry gifts and food and is therefore forced to interact with local people and to hunt. You will encounter wildlife, hostile people and various disasters which will wear down your health and sanity. Your object is to accumulate more Drama Points (for the publisher back home) than your competitors before any of the player's explorer dies or goes mad in the bush.

name.value: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Naboo & Battle of Hoth

item.description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.

link.value: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Yavin
Star Wars: Box Busters – Endor Attack
Star Wars: Box Busters – Tusken Raider Attack & The Battle of Yavin

item.description:
Corporations begin setting up special zoos across the world, but the cost for security spiraled out of control and the zoos began to keep the dinosaurs tranquilized. Demand quickly waned and underground fight clubs of excess dinosaurs became popular and began producing huge dividends. Larger and larger dinosaurs were pitted against each other until today we have Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting. With millions of dollars involved, special training schools appeared, and soon Dinosaur Pit Fighting was the most popular sport in the world.

Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting is a Tactical Battle board game. Players win by wounding other dinosaurs to attain victory points and staying alive. When the first dinosaur in the pit dies the game ends on the following turn.

Players choose between 8 different dinosaurs to fight with and place their miniature on the board. Each dinosaur has a different number of life points and different custom abilities and tactics needed to win. Each turn is a combination of movement based on speed and simultaneous action declarations.

You can play one-off fights or use the campaign rules to control a pen of dinosaurs and give them Training, Mutations and Tech upgrades to improve your dinosaurs and make them unique in the world of Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting.

Brought to you by Dark Cult Games

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

Momentum Football is truly unique in that it allows you to quickly play a full game in 15-20 minutes while yielding not only team stats, but also individual player stats. With Momentum Football you'll be able to track the following team and individual stats:Passing Attempts, Passing Completions, Total Passing yardage, Interceptions, Fumbles Lost, Sacks, Rushing Attempts, Rushing Yardage, and all scoring.

Momentum Football uses a drive-by-drive approach to resolve games. But, don’t let the simplicity fool you. Over 254 variables are used to create each team’s chart making them highly accurate for both team performance and individual player performance. And best of all, we’ve designed the game so that there is little to no set-up time involved. As you become comfortable with the rules, you’ll be able to grab two team sheets, a score sheet and four dice and begin play immediately.

Games are resolved drive-by-drive, rather than play-by-play. But, again, don’t let that fool you into thinking that individual contributions aren’t important. You’ll quickly see the impact of great rushers, passers and receivers on offense and pass rushers, cover men and big hitters on defense. So, while the game is resolved by drives, individual player contributions are the difference between winning and losing.
Don’t fret; special teams, penalties, turnovers, home field advantage, and a team’s momentum are all captured within the game. You’ll be amazed as you watch everything unfold on your tabletop just as it does in real life.

As the name of the game implies, capturing the momentum as it swings from one team to the other is a big part of the game. Our system is unique in that it doesn’t overly dominate the game mechanics nor is it over stated. However, just as in real life, a team’s momentum can mean all of the difference between winning and losing.

Shattered Earth is a tabletop war game set on Earth many decades into the future, after the world has been ravaged by an unprecedented number of natural disasters. The geology of the Earth has been forever changed, now cracked and broken, existing landmasses drowned in vast oceans whilst others have formed anew, created by the seismic movements of tectonic plates.

Each cataclysmic shockwave formed by extinction-level natural disasters pounded against the door of another world – a mirror image of our own – until eventually that door gave way. The resulting breach flooded the Earth with an esoteric power known as Ether, a volatile energy that is the very foundation of the Immateria, the world of dreams. And in return, the material world bled into the breach, corrupting and choking everything it touched.

Mankind now struggles to comprehend this new power, seeing in it both ruin and salvation. Scientists attempt to harness its energy to create wondrous new technology, whilst others practice dark rituals and worship strange new powers, using Ether to alter their surroundings and themselves, bending reality to their whim.

This is 30 A.E. This is Shattered Earth.

name.value: Timeline: Star Wars – Episode I, II, III
Timeline: Star Wars – Episodi I, II, III
Timeline: Star Wars – Episodi IV, V, VI

item.description: Timeline: Star Wars is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts a Star Wars Universe event on both sides, with a number referring to the point in time in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the time information on it. If the card was placed correctly with the number in chronological order with respect to all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

name.value: The Good Dinosaur: Roarin' River Game

item.description:
Race the rapids to get home!

Work together as a team to hep Arlo and his friends outrun the flooding river! Travel through Dangerous Canyons, Mountain Forests, and Sweeping Plains!

A dice rolling, platforming, race to the finish game. 
Use a myriad of items to alter your bros turn, or boost your rolls, use your cheat code to level the playing field or get ahead of the competition.
Be the first to get to the flag pole to claim your victory and ultimate bragging rights.

Mech Defense is a cooperative, tower defense inspired, strategy game where a group of 4 players pilot 20ft Mechs and rain down destruction on their foes. Your squad fends off wave after wave of incoming enemies over 12 missions and permanently alter your battlefield with every decision and explosive attack. The more you destroy, the more you get paid, but the stronger your foes become.

As a Legacy game, with over 20 sticker sheets included in the box, players will permanently upgrade enemies and modify the map with every mission you play.

The game also includes a native application for Windows, iOS, Android, and Windows Phone to help manage progress between missions. For people who prefer not to have the digital component, players can use a printable sheet to track progress.
